intro: Verbascum dingleri, commonly known as the Desert Mullein, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to hot, dry environments and possesses deep root systems to access water. Its leaves are large, broad, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Verbascum dingleri is often found in rocky soils and is a hardy plant that thrives in low-nutrient conditions.
